website_summaries.verdict: Impressive quality given the price, so it's a popular choice for novice cooks.
pros: Razor-sharp and made from high-carbon, stain-resistant Japanese steel
Easy to sharpen given its hollow ground edge
Comes with a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Not ideal if you're looking for a traditional wood handle

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my favorite knife! I love that it is a little more hefty than most commercial stamped knives. The blade is very, very sharp, so those that are used to a dull blade are going to need to be VERY careful at first. There handle is wide, and it has a great ribbed section where your thumb and fingers go (if you hold the knife the CORRECT way). I love the fact that it is so affordable--to the point that it is disposable when you drop it or if someone accidentally puts it in the sink. I absolutely recommend this knife! Questions? Let me know. Helpful? Let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher MN

customer_reviews.title: Who says you can't get something for nothing?
customer_reviews.text: My favorite paring knife that I had for decades was somehow lost. I had a hard time finding a replacement that was the right size but also not junk. I stumbled across this Mercer knife on Amazon. Its cost was less than $3, but it was very well reviewed. It turns out to be a small miracle. It's made of top-grade cutlery steel and is delivered literally razor sharp. It holds that edge quite well. Value, defined as quality divided by cost, is extremely high. I'd recommend Mercer knives without reservation if they're all like this little paring knife that was priced so low as to be almost free.
customer_reviews.author: milleron

customer_reviews.title: Just as sharp as expensive Miyabi
customer_reviews.text: This knife is sharp and perfect for everyday use. Because of its price, I don't have to be super careful unlike expensive Japanese knives such as Shun or Miyabi. When cutting up a whole chicken, I use this Mercer knife rather than a Shun or Miyabi and it is super sharp and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Susie L

customer_reviews.title: So far......so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several paring knives that were an epic fail when it come to peeling potatoes or turnips. I have rather small hands and most either had too big of a handle and/or the blade was too dull.......making the task awkward, uncomfortable, and unsafe. This little knife is super sharp and small enough to make quick maneuvers around your spuds. I haven't had it long enough to know how well it sharpens when needed but, at this price, I'll just buy another!
customer_reviews.author: River Girl

customer_reviews.title: Dulls very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This knife was super sharp when I first received it but thats no longer the case. I hand wash my knives very carefully so I was surprised how quickly it dulled.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Best knife for the price, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I always thought you had to spend a lot for a quality knife. A bunch of ole boys told me you wouldn’t beat Mercer for the money so I got this boning knife to process my deer. First thought was it is much more stout than I imagined it would be judging by the photo. It is a plastic handle but it’s a good sized grip and the blade seems super solid. Was delivered sharp as a razor blade and worked great for deboning and parting my deer. For the price you just plain can’t beat it. They’ve made a believer out of me, I’m going to buy multiple Mercer knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is quite nice. I find that I need to sharpen it pretty much with every use. But it sharpens nicely and cuts well. It fits comfortably in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special!!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is not anything special. I was not impressed with the how not sharp it is. With out any kind of cover makes it hard to safely find a spot for it. After reading all the great reviews ..... I thought I was getting a knife that was gold. Lol. The 5 star reviews must be fake.
customer_reviews.author: ba

customer_reviews.title: My complaint: I should have bought more than 1 Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I really really wish i had ordered more than one. Add on item price is less! than $3. It's better than any paring knife 🔪 that i owned. It has a comfy feel about it. My hands are kind of small but that doesn't seem to matter to this knife. Wow. This is a find. I was on Amazon for medical diabetic supplies and that's not much fun. I thought I would peep at the add on items. Came very quickly. Packing is great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: therose

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and sharp blade, offset handle design, and affordable.  Sold!
customer_reviews.text: Overkill on the blade materials, this thing is sharp. The wavy edge blade is just right for breads, and I remember it being advertised as a bread knife. But it makes a terrific cake knife, which is what I use it for. The handle feels cheap, but it is doing it’s job nicely. The offset handle design helps when cutting through a cake, as my hand does not hit the table when I am cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Mark MasakiTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bread knife for crusty breads
customer_reviews.text: During covid times I picked up bread making. I have a serrated utility knife but it was too short for the breads I would turn out. I looked at bread slicers and then thought, maybe I don't need a slicer, I need a better knife. This fit the bill nicely and at a great price. It seems durable and I could see using it on other tough to cut items like chicken bones, etc.
customer_reviews.author: woojo

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised
customer_reviews.text: I process my own game so a sharp knife is a must have. We moved recently and the boning knife has yet to be discovered. So for a short term need I gave this one a try. It performed as well and maybe better than my more expensive knife. It holds an edge well. The comments about not being able to resharpen are likely a lack of skill on the users part.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Knife for Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several knives for use in a busy restaurant kitchen. This one is emerging as one of the favorites, as they like the 8" length better than 10" in most cases, plus the grip on this one is good even with oily hands. Stays sharp for a reasonable amount of time; Maybe a week in my environment. Compares favorably with the Update International knives. So far have purchased 4 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Greenbridge

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as expected
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews I expected this knife to be sharp as a scalpel. Perhaps it cuts the skin very easily - and I don't want to find out - but they don't cut some foods as well as I'd hoped. It's just an OK knife, but for the price I shouldn't have expected much. I got some expensive professional chef's knives long ago (German made but the name is worn off now) and was very disappointed at how dull they always were and that they had to be sharpened after each use, so why should these be any better...
customer_reviews.author: hmmm

customer_reviews.title: Good knife but rust starting within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife daily in the kitchen I work at. So, 5 days a week. I clean it daily and sharpen it every few days. Ironically, right below the words "stainless steel" is a small rust spot I cannot clean off. So, the knife is good. I do however question the stainless part of the blade. As, mine is stained in 2 months with very heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I've come to expect from Mercer.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality for the price. I prefer to use my chef's knife for pretty much everything in the kitchen except for cutting bread. You need a good price point for such a niche piece of equipment, and this knife accomplishes exactly that. Also, since serrated knives are more trouble to sharpen than they're worth, it's nice to know that the price on this unit is such that once it gets dull, I can feel comfortable with buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: modestmau5

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp... very big!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife for slicing meat and vegetables. It maintains a good edge and rarely needs sharpening. The only issue is that it's HUGE, making a bit hard to wield. It's perfect for things like slicing a London Broil, but a bit hard for smaller tasks. Overall, I'm glad I have it but find myself using an 8" chefs knife for 6" utility knife more often.
customer_reviews.author: njAlan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold a sharp edge
customer_reviews.text: I sharpen this knife before/after every use.. it doesn't stay sharp. 6 months on now, Suggestion? buy a real knife with high carbon steel.. this one? nah, I'm sorry that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Great Sharp Knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim packer briskets with and was amazed with the quality for the price. It made easy work of the brisket and I have since used it to cut through chicken bones to split out wing sections. The knife is so sharp that it actually cut into one of my fingers when it ran into the side of it. As in the knife just went into the side of my finger, it didn't cut across. Knife is like a katana. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S.

customer_reviews.title: Great pairing knive. Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this knife about 6 times so far. Sooooo handy. Love the feel of the handle. Nice weight. Very sharp. Very reasonable price. Would make a nice gift packaged with a small cutting board (bamboo etc.) with or without cheeses and fruit. I really like this knife. I'm going to try more of their products. I paid full price for this knife. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sandyTop Contributor: Bread Making

customer_reviews.title: Better than the expensive ones I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I took a sushi cooking class and the instructor had several of these for us to use. I thought I'd try one at home and I love it. So far, it has stayed very sharp. It is relatively light weight and can make paper thin cuts. I've tried many brands of high end, relatively expensive knives over the years and am always disappointed although I haven't ever invested in the super expensive ones that chefs use. I can't believe this slices so well for such a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: mumzy50

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and sturdier than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately since I've bought this knife I haven't used on any wild game larger than a squirrel but I have come to love this knife in the kitchen as a much sturdier fillet knife when dealing with salmon or whenever I just want a nice sturdy small blade. I've been using this knife more and more and I'm likely going to add a few to my kitchen and get rid of some I dont really use at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top quality at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: These are super high quality knives. I use mine commercially and they get a lot of use, and the blade holds its sharpness for a long, long time, which is a big plus. These are the knives you need for a commercial kitchen, but if you love quality and longevity, get these for home use as well... you won't need to buy any chef's knives for a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: K. HarrigerTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Holy sharpness!!
customer_reviews.text: Watch yourself with this, it's freaking VERY sharp, keep away from the children!! Nice smooth edge that will be acceptable to sharpening is a bonus. Nice clean lines and a nice weight. Easily cleanable.
customer_reviews.author: thepiratemorgan

customer_reviews.title: Dulls quick
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, came super sharp used it twice to trim up some pork shoulders just fat and membrane off and with that little bit of use it’s pretty dull now. Wish I would have saved up a lil more and just went with a really good brand.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Have to sharpen often
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, (I've had it 3 months now) it was super sharp; cutting through everything including my finger. But after regular use, I notice it dulls quicker than any other knife I own. I've sharpened it quite a few times and will have to continue because when it is dull, it won't even pierce tomato skin.
customer_reviews.author: debenbrie

customer_reviews.title: We love to cook and decided to splurge on this knife ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are young college students and we cook all our meals. We love to cook and decided to splurge on this knife and a set of mercer knives. There is a big different between the mercer knives and the generic ones we were using before. If you are questioning whether to get these or not- buy them. This one is especially sharp, and it makes the prep work for cooking significantly different. The mercer knives are well worth the money, and we did not know how much we were missing out on having a quality knife set until we saw how much of a difference it made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, easy to clean boning and trimming knife with a sanitary construction. The only negative I found is that it arrived with an edge that, in my opinion, could have benefitted by a little final honing to get the sharpness I expected. I'll have to get out the stones and leather strop for this one.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: A very Good paring knife.
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife. Easy to hold and cuts well. I’ve not had it long enough to know how well it holds an edge. However, I did cut some thick cardboard. It was still sharp after that. I edited this a day, or so later. I’ve cut more cardboard and several food items with it. It still has a very sharp edge. It’s a very good paring knife.
customer_reviews.author: Darvin

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the pricr
customer_reviews.text: This chef’s knife suit my needs well. I am an occasional cook and do not need a great feel as much as I need a sharp, easy clean knife. I like the white plastic handle better than my old wooden handles knives. Not for the pro, but works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: dolly

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Stays sharp, easy to clean. A well balanced knife. I have two hundred dollar knives that I don't use anymore because of this knife. Definitely will be your go to chef knife. Don't hesitate. Buy this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bread knife.
customer_reviews.text: Blade is not too long as some bread knives are, and a great tomato slice,r.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great for boning out your own venison.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is very sharp and holds it's edge very well. Easy to sharpen when needed. Easy on the hand after boning out 32 deer just this bow season already. Not my own....LOL It was delivered in a timely manner. I plan on it lasting many seasons to come, if not , they have a warranty .
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot beat this value, doesn't hold an edge as long as stronger steel but sharpens very quickly and easily. For average day to day kitchen needs this has been great
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am glad to have bought this Mercer 6" after getting the 9" offset serrated knife. It's just as sharp and good to cut smaller items like lemons or tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: H C

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my aunt
customer_reviews.text: A really nice gift for my aunt! Personally I prefer my Whustofs for personal use however I gifted this knife to my aunt who is not big on knives. All of hers where tremendously dull and so I showed her what a nice knife can do! hopefully she'll see the light and keep using sharp knives!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: No frills knife, good metal, sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: We have Mercer's chef knife for several years and we are happy with it so we decided to buy this paring knife. It's not going to impress anyone by the way it looks or feels to hold, but the blade is high quality. Great every day knife. It would be nice if they added dimples to the thumbrest on this knife as they have on the chef's knife.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quite good in the beginning but it seems they are losing ...
customer_reviews.text: Quite good in the beginning but it seems they are losing their "edge" lately when I try sharpening them.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: As i’ve been getting more into cooking, I’ve been slowly improving the quality of knives I use. I bought this on a whim, because it looked really nice and it was super cheap. The difference between this knife and the other ones I have is astounding. Now all I have to do is to just be careful that I don’t slip and cut myself instead!
customer_reviews.author: JustSayErin

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I love the knife. 5 stars except DON’T drop it. The steel is soft and the tip will bend. On the other hand , it’s the best knife for the money. Holds a good edge. I’m a chef and I’m always using it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a sharp knife
customer_reviews.text: Ever since we got this knife, it has become our go to knife for all sort of cutting. This is a bit bigger than everyday knife but we like it so much that we just use it (One drawback for us is that its big so it doesnt fit in the wooden knife block so we just keep it in the drawer, its sharp, its heavy and it does what its supposed to do, very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Sujan

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was half scared to get this paring knife & other sizes because reviews warned how sharp they were. I even ordered the cut resistant gloves for fear I'd end up in the ER! It just isn't that sharp - like my little $1 paring knife from the farm market. I'd also ordered 2 paring knives & the 6" chef knife & 7" filet knife & no cut gloves for my Son & DIL. They like the 6" knife, haven't heard about the filet. Maybe I got an off one. The price was good, just wasn't what I'd expected.
customer_reviews.author: L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a good knife
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great meat carving knife. Instead of buying myself a fancy $30 knife, I figured I will give this knife a try. This knife works very well, it is very sharp. Although the plastic handle feels cheap, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Cozilla

customer_reviews.title: tool knife
customer_reviews.text: Adequate for purpose. Not razor sharp, but good enough. And I don't fear that others will injure themselves with unexpected cutting ability.
customer_reviews.author: jcricket

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Go To Knife Of Choice
customer_reviews.text: Sharpest, light weight, fatigue free designed, hamburger bun slicer and cold tomato slicer. I’m 56 years old and this ideal item would have been my handy, go to knife for many years if I knew about it sooner. Fits nicely in my hand and as sharp as a Samaria Sword! So very little strength needed to use this knife effectively. A 5 star rating for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly T. Shupryt

customer_reviews.title: OMG! Fantastic little knife.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an RV. Holds an edge. Light and doent slip like my super expensive one. My new go to paring knife. If I did not have the fancy expensive set, I would take more of this brand. This knife holds its edge longer. Easy to sharpen too.
customer_reviews.author: kidsrmylife

customer_reviews.title: Very good but is rusting already :(
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as an alternative to more expensive Henckels to have an ordinary chef's knife you can actually sharp. It came very sharp out of the box, worked fine but began to rust after a month of daily use and delicate wash. That's why only 3 stars, sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: I have a big assortment of knifes and this one is the best and most sharp of them all I am very happy with the quality and look forward to getting more of there knifes. If you're comparing them to the professional Tramontina they are much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T.

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp knife!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp knife! Awesome, but be careful! I accidentally had mine floating in dishwater, didn’t realize and when I stuck my hand in it, cut the heck out of it. My fault though! Knife is awesome just be more careful than me!
customer_reviews.author: rauschaus

customer_reviews.title: Is super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this knife sharp, right out of the box! Went to wash it with a sponge, and shaved half the sponge apart! Cuts amazingly, easy to handle, and feels nice in the hand. Would buy again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy 407

customer_reviews.title: impressed
customer_reviews.text: For the price in this knife i wasn't really sure how well it would preform. It cut so beautiful at first used and was supper impressed. Makes me want to buy the other sizes. It works so good and the price is even better.
customer_reviews.author: KARINA

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife! Commercial quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall its a great little knife that is surprisingly sharp. I had been using some cheap knife sets that did not sharpen well or hold their edge so started looking for something commercial like I used to use when working in a restaurant as a kid. This did the trick, I was able to carve up brisket and ribs much easier. I am interested to see how easily they sharpen or if any issues come up.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife
customer_reviews.text: Great little paring knife. I'm not a professional cook, but use this often to cut fruit (& other foods). For the price and quality this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckle

customer_reviews.title: Don't Expect much from a cheap Knife !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Knife after reading all the good reviews about it. After having used for almost 2 months now on daily bases ,I can tell you that It has lost its sharpness significantly. I wasn't expecting much anyhow cause as I said it's just cheap Knife .
customer_reviews.author: Lito

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely top quality. Sharp from the box, doesn't scratch, and the edge holds up extremely well. Absolutely the best knife you can buy for the money. I'd easily take it over some $150+ "name brand' knives.
customer_reviews.author: L_T

customer_reviews.title: Ok product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Sharp knife right out of the box. I was really impressed. After the first initial use, the sharpness faded quickly. By the third use, I had troubled slicing through tomatoes. These knives had to be sharpen constantly prior to each use.
customer_reviews.author: kham vang

customer_reviews.title: A Whole Lotta Knife
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my husband, as he is happy to receive knives for every gift-giving occasion. Now that it is in the kitchen, I find that it works really well for cutting 12" pizzas... :-) Itʻs really well made and I think it will be used for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's a well balanced and comfortable knife to use. Holds an edge well and seems to be of high quality for the price. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money I was really impressed with this knife, its worth it
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great out of the box. Cant really get same sharpness back after using it, but a great knife for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Calandrelli

customer_reviews.title: very sharp
customer_reviews.text: The item was recieved really fast. It is much like the ones I used to use when I work in a butcher shop very sharp and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M. Formanek

customer_reviews.title: Great knife at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Boom! Love this knife. Fits my hand and has just the right amount of flex in the blade to work perfectly! Love this little knife! Oh and super sharp
customer_reviews.author: David Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brisket knife on the cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive brisket knife to take to a party. This is now my go to brisket knife! This knife cuts through tender brisket like a hot knife through butter allowing you to keep the bark intact on every slice! Blown away by a knife that’s under $13 with tax and delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale but they are worth every penny. Bought 2 several months ago and haven't opened up the second yet since the first is still sharp. Use it almost everyday and I use it to butcher deer meat off the bone which is murder on knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good budget long knife
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it shipped to me. The knife is ok, I use it to cut bread, but doesn't cut meat all that well due to the serration. But great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Wang

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: Career chef. Solid unit for the price. Maneuvering any knife is in the experience of the user. Filet knives are not the easiest ones to use. If you are a novice expect to poke yourself occasionally
customer_reviews.author: Ranjit

customer_reviews.title: Good knife, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I like it better than the Victorinox it was meant to replace! Seems to hold an edge and is well made, I would prefer it were just a bit heavier/heartier because it “feels” very light (but not flimsy) and I use this wearing gloves so it gets fumbled more than a heavier knife would.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Thomas Eiswirth

customer_reviews.title: It’s what I expected for $.
customer_reviews.text: Too easily maneuvered. I couldn’t resist the affordable add-on price I got this at but it’s too flexible of a knife for me. It’s really only appropriate for soft fruits like peaches, apricots or tomatoes. It’s very sharp but as flexible as a fillet knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Handy in the car
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in the car in its original packaging though I did wash it first. Having a sharp knife like this in the car is perfect if you want to stop on the road for a piece of fruit or bread and cheese etc. while traveling. The price is right so it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Lakewood, Ohio

customer_reviews.title: A solid bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Whats not to like. I have more expensive knifes but this has become my go to Chief knife. I love the "grippy" handle. You really don't have to spend more money on a 8 in. Kitchen knife. Its a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I had some pampered chef knives tht were getting very dull, and bought this as a replacement. So far it works wonderful. Very happy with this purchase. Works just as well as the pampered chef and for less than a 1/4 of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Britttx3

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 minutes of arrival I was bleeding. Don’t be fooled by the price, it’s sharp!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Dishwasher this bad-boy!!
customer_reviews.text: It's my new favorite knife since my mother won't let me put her wooden handled Japanese knives in the dishwasher this sucker can go on the top shelf and comes out just as happy as he went in and it is wicked sharp too
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Good knife at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Life long banquet chef here. I stopped buying high high end knifes due to thieves and young cooks always “borrowing” This knife is priced right, comes with a razors edge. These knifes see plenty of action.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Froggy

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomically fine, but...
customer_reviews.text: Like the knife, however doesn't hold an edge for very long at all. But for the price, acceptable I guess. Have two other mercer knives I like just fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Gill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bread Knife
customer_reviews.text: The best bread knife I have owned. Easy to hold and slice. Gives great control so you can slice thick or thin slices of a loaf. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Maria S. Mastroianni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I wish the blade was made in Japan before. However it's made in Taiwan. Not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: H R

customer_reviews.title: Too Slippery Plastic Handle
customer_reviews.text: Slippery Handle. First use, cutting steaks, soon as I touched meat to turn it, I couldn’t grip the handle tightly, knife kept slipping out of my hand. Even after wiping off the handle with paper towel, it remained too slippery to grip firmly. I’ll try to wrap tape around it before next use, but if that doesn’t help I’m returning it
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Roth

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: This knife is larger than I thought. The handle is big so it makes it more difficult to maneuver. The blade is wider than I expected and has no flexibility. I think I am happier with my old clunker knife.
customer_reviews.author: Horselover

customer_reviews.title: For more than just bread!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife to have. I use it to cut vegetables, fruits and meats even though it’s called a bread knife. A good price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: M'arilyn

customer_reviews.title: Holds a blade well, a very durable Blade and handle.
customer_reviews.text: This knife works great. Holds a sharp edge, dorable and slices through thick steaks and roasts without bending. The handle makes it easy to rip without your hands slipping. I would definitely recommend it. A great knife.
customer_reviews.author: BigJim

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like buttah
customer_reviews.text: It works! It slices smoothly and easily. And the price is great. I wasn't sure that I needed another knife in the crock, but I cook a lot, from scratch, and thought I could try it. For $15 you can change your life for the better.
customer_reviews.author: PittsburghRedhead

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: Very solid for the price. You definitely get more than you pay for. However the ergonomics of the handle could be better. However, I have huge hands. I bought it for a thanksgiving I was preparing out of town.
customer_reviews.author: PhoTown

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good knife!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use as a bread knife because it was less expensive than ones specifically labeled "bread knife". It seems to be well made & it works just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Chilly

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price! Very sharp and will become your go to knife in the drawer!
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly sharp! Does the job well and great quality for the price. I will definitely be getting a few more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Blake and Emma Tubbs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bread machine bread
customer_reviews.text: Finally a knife long enough and sharp enough to make thin slices of bread machine bread.
customer_reviews.author: vickie

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sharp and easy to use paring knife. I feel the handle could be a bit larger but other than that I'm happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: VERY SHARP
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the knife exceeded my expectations. I always cut tomatoes as a way to test them. This cut through tomatoes so easily.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for chopping up fruit and veggies for snacks, they work great for apples, cucumbers, carrots and peppers. My husband uses them for chopping up his steak and he says they work well for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Price  quality
customer_reviews.text: As a chef, this is a quality eveyday knife, holds its edge, is comfortable when cutting, price and craftmanship allows to purchase more if needed
customer_reviews.author: tortoni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter chef's knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic knife for the price. I havend had it long enough to know how durable it is but it is easy to use, very sharp and makes quick work of all the slicing and chopping assigned to it. I am even considering buying a second one so I can use one for meat and one for vegetables while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: frank morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not A Good Knife
customer_reviews.text: Not a good knife. Sliced up tomato, onion and lettuce and it's dull already. To make it worse, it won't even take an edge on my sharpener. That's why I gave it 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: alan l.

customer_reviews.title: Real work knife
customer_reviews.text: If you need a real chef knife for real kitchen work this is a good deal. All the fancy ones are just show off toys.
customer_reviews.author: Malcus

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I am making homemade bread and needed something that would cut the bread without pressing into it. This knife is perfect, and it cuts the bread very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal little knife. For only a few bucks you can have something that comes razor-sharp out of the box. They hold up well to dishwasher use, not that you should be putting your knives in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: J Ko.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and great price
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a chef/culinary professor, I was surprised by the price, but even more surprised by the quality. I purchased 5 and use them daily for hollowing fruit, veggies, detail work, and all the things paring knives do.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Bread knife
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as the other Mercer knifes I have, this being serated , I doubt it matters. Goes through bread great. I have other knives sharp enough for tomatoes so, haven't tried that...
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly sharp
customer_reviews.text: For the price this knife is a bargain. The first day I had this knife, I knocked it off the counter it dropped down and sliced my leg causing me to get 9 stitches, it was at that moment I knew this was a great purchase. Extremely sharp
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. So far seems to be holding up to the dish washer and it cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal, like a professional would use. No fancy handles no fancy price tag,, just a functional knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mercer Culinary M18170 Paring Knife, 3", White
product_meta.description: Style Name:3 Inch Ultimate Paring KnifeAn exceptional combination of quality, design, materials and craftsmanship for the value minded kitchen.
feature_bullets: Razor sharp, high carbon, stain-resistant Japanese steel
Hollow ground edge for easy edge maintenance and rapid sharpening
Ergonomic polypropylene handle with textured finger points for better grip, slip-resistance, and safety
Hand wash knives for blade edge and surface care
NSF certified with a Limited Lifetime Warranty
